programme.title: Fixer to Fabulous
programme.desc: A couple with family ties to Peru have purchased a small house that they want to make their forever home, but it needs a lot of work; Dave and Jenny brighten up the home and incorporate a Peruvian design-style with personal touches.

programme.title: Fixer to Fabulous

programme.desc: High school sweethearts turn to their friends Lyndsay and Leslie to help sell their old tri-level home in a neighborhood of new builds; the twins update the home with a warm, minimalist style; Lyndsay makes plans with her own sweetheart.

programme.title: Unsellable Houses

programme.desc: David takes a family that won $100,000 on a scratcher on a tour of family-friendly areas in Cedar Rapids, Iowa, that are close to schools and golf courses.

programme.title: The Thomas Crown Affair
programme.desc: A billionaire (Pierce Brosnan) looking for new challenges attracts the attention of an investigator (Rene Russo) when a priceless Monet is stolen.

programme.title: Conviction
programme.desc: Following the imprisonment of her brother (Sam Rockwell), a woman (Hilary Swank) earns a law degree and fights to clear him of murder.

programme.title: Flashdance
programme.desc: A Pittsburgh welder (Jennifer Beals) dances nights in a bar, dates her boss (Michael Nouri) and dreams of going to ballet school.

programme.title: Lucky
programme.desc: A 90-year-old atheist has outlived and out-smoked his contemporaries, and as he comes to terms with his own mortality, he searches for ever-elusive enlightenment.

programme.title: Source Code
programme.desc: A helicopter pilot (Jake Gyllenhaal) takes part in a secret government program that enables him to assume someone's identity and experience the last few minutes of that person's life.

programme.title: Gemini
programme.desc: A heinous crime tests the complex relationship between a Hollywood starlet and her tenacious personal assistant. As the assistant unravels the mystery, she must confront her own understanding of friendship, truth and celebrity.

programme.title: Locke
programme.desc: A man's (Tom Hardy) life unravels after he leaves a construction site at a critical time and drives to London to be present for the birth of a child conceived during a one-night stand.

programme.title: Mississippi Grind
programme.desc: Convinced that his newfound friend (Ryan Reynolds) is a good-luck charm, a gambling addict (Ben Mendelsohn) takes the man on a road trip to a high-stakes poker game in New Orleans.

programme.title: Out of Time
programme.desc: Considered a suspect in a deadly arson, a police chief (Denzel Washington) must cover his tracks while trying to prove his innocence.

programme.title: The Bourne Ultimatum
programme.desc: Jason Bourne (Matt Damon) continues his international quest to uncover his true identity while staying one step ahead of those who want to kill him.

programme.title: Gulliver's Travels
programme.desc: Animators Max and Dave Fleischer's adaptation of Jonathan Swift's classic about a shipwrecked Englishman in Lilliput.

programme.title: The New World
programme.desc: Explorer John Smith (Colin Farrell) lands in 17th-century North America.

programme.title: The Witch
programme.desc: In 1630 New England, members of a farming family suspect the oldest daughter of witchcraft when the youngest son suddenly vanishes.

programme.title: Dark Places
programme.desc: A woman (Charlize Theron) confronts traumatic, childhood memories of the murder of her mother and two sisters when she investigates the possibility that her brother (Corey Stoll) is innocent of the crime.

programme.title: Youth
programme.desc: Fred (Michael Caine), a retired composer and conductor, vacations at a Swiss Spa with his longtime friend Mick (Harvey Keitel). As Mick crafts what may be his final screenplay, Fred is given the opportunity to perform for the Queen.

programme.title: Youth
programme.desc: Fred (Michael Caine), a retired composer and conductor, vacations at a Swiss Spa with his longtime friend Mick (Harvey Keitel). As Mick crafts what may be his final screenplay, Fred is given the opportunity to perform for the Queen.

programme.title: Wild Rose
programme.desc: Fresh out of prison, a Scottish woman juggles her job and two children while pursuing her dream of becoming a country music star. She soon gets her chance when she travels to Nashville, Tenn., on a life-changing journey to discover her true voice.

programme.title: The Weekend
programme.desc: A down-on-her-luck comedian's vacation plans are interrupted by her ex-boyfriend and his new girlfriend.

programme.title: Kingpin
programme.desc: A one-handed salesman (Woody Harrelson), an Amish farm boy (Randy Quaid) and a pretty con artist (Vanessa Angel) pull bowling scams to get to a $1 million tournament in Reno.

programme.title: Into the Blue
programme.desc: Four divers (Paul Walker, Jessica Alba, Scott Caan) cross paths with drug smugglers whose cargo plane has crashed near the site of underwater treasure.

programme.title: The Pink Panther 2
programme.desc: Clouseau (Steve Martin) and a team of international detectives investigate the thefts of the world's greatest treasures, including the diamond called the Pink Panther.

programme.title: Altitude
programme.desc: An FBI agent finds herself choosing sides between two factions of a criminal gang while trying to keep her hijacked plane from going down.

programme.title: The Strangers
programme.desc: Three masked assailants terrorize a young couple (Liv Tyler, Scott Speedman) in a romantic getaway to a remote cottage.

programme.title: Little Woods
programme.desc: In North Dakota, two estranged sisters are driven to extremes when their mother dies, leaving them with one week to pay back her mortgage.

programme.title: The Forbidden Kingdom
programme.desc: A teenage fan (Michael Angarano) of Hong Kong cinema finds a Chinese relic and travels back in time to help legendary martial-artists free the Monkey King.

programme.title: A Most Violent Year
programme.desc: In 1981 New York, a fuel supplier (Oscar Isaac) tries to adhere to his own moral compass amid the rampant violence, corruption and decay that threaten his family and his business.

programme.title: The Captive
programme.desc: Eight years after a child disappeared without a trace, detectives find disturbing clues that indicate that the girl is still alive.

programme.title: First Reformed
programme.desc: The pastor of a small church in upstate New York spirals out of control after a soul-shaking encounter with an unstable environmental activist and his pregnant wife.

programme.title: Tusk
programme.desc: A U.S. podcaster (Justin Long) ventures into the Canadian wilderness to interview an old man (Michael Parks) who has an extraordinary past, and the American learns the man has a dark secret involving a walrus.

programme.title: The Sea of Trees
programme.desc: After traveling to Japan's Aokigahara Forest, a troubled teacher (Matthew McConaughey) meets a mysterious stranger (Ken Watanabe) who takes him on a life-changing journey of love, discovery and redemption.

programme.title: The Sea of Trees
programme.desc: After traveling to Japan's Aokigahara Forest, a troubled teacher (Matthew McConaughey) meets a mysterious stranger (Ken Watanabe) who takes him on a life-changing journey of love, discovery and redemption.

programme.title: My Boss's Daughter
programme.desc: To impress a young woman (Tara Reid), a man (Ashton Kutcher) agrees to housesit at his employer's mansion for one night.

programme.title: The Spy Who Loved Me
programme.desc: Agent 007 (Roger Moore) and a Russian beauty (Barbara Bach) foil a madman (Curt Jurgens) in a submarine, who is out to nuke the world.

programme.title: The Ice Storm
programme.desc: Suburbanites (Kevin Kline, Joan Allen) in failing marriages seek fulfillment elsewhere, while their teen children explore sexuality.

programme.title: Fargo
programme.desc: A pregnant police chief (Frances McDormand) probes the murderous events that evolved from a desperate car salesman's (William H. Macy) kidnapping scheme.

programme.title: A Serious Man
programme.desc: An adulterous wife and a burdensome brother are among the problems that send a 1960s college professor (Michael Stuhlbarg) to seek help from three different rabbis.

programme.title: Body of Lies
programme.desc: A CIA operative (Leonardo DiCaprio) hatches a dangerous plan to catch the leader of a terrorist organization, but conflicts with his two closest allies (Russell Crowe, Mark Strong) may cost him his life.

programme.title: Barely Lethal
programme.desc: Seeking a normal adolescence, a special-operations agent (Hailee Steinfeld) fakes her own death and enrolls in high school as an exchange student.

programme.title: The Losers
programme.desc: A mysterious operative (Zoe Saldana) joins forces with a group of elite commandos (Jeffrey Dean Morgan, Chris Evans), as they hunt the man who organized a lethal betrayal against them.

programme.title: Scott Pilgrim vs. the World
programme.desc: After meeting the gal (Mary Elizabeth Winstead) of his dreams, a charming slacker (Michael Cera) must contend with an army of her ex-boyfriends, wanting to get rid of him.

programme.title: Ex Machina
programme.desc: A young programmer (Domhnall Gleeson) at an Internet company is chosen to evaluate the capabilities and consciousness of a beautiful and sophisticated robot (Alicia Vikander).

programme.title: Spaceballs
programme.desc: President Skroob (Mel Brooks) pits evil Dark Helmet (Rick Moranis) against Lone Starr and the half-man, half-dog Barf (John Candy).

programme.title: Bandits
programme.desc: Two bank robbers (Bruce Willis, Billy Bob Thornton) fall for a bored housewife (Cate Blanchett) who helps them commit heists across the country.

programme.title: Custom Carolina

programme.title: Roadkill Garage

programme.title: Roadkill Garage
